intro: Rhodanthe citrina, commonly known as the golden rhodanthe, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flower heads. Rhodanthe citrina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
